text: Below is a list of covered bridges in Maryland. There are six authentic covered bridges in the U.S. state of Maryland of which five are historic. A covered bridge is considered authentic not due to its age, but by its construction. An authentic bridge is constructed using trusses rather than other methods such as stringers, a popular choice for non-authentic covered bridges. ==List== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Name ! class=unsortable |Image ! County ! Location ! Built ! Length ! Crosses ! Ownership ! Truss !
